content.description: Runners <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> and <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math> are running in the same direction. At position <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, runners <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> and <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math> have speeds <math alttext="v sub P" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub Q" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></msub></math> respectively, as shown. While running, the acceleration of Runner <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> is <math alttext="a sub P" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></msub></math>, where <math alttext="a sub P is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>a</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></msub><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math>, and the acceleration of Runner <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math> is <math alttext="2 a sub P" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> <msub> <mi>a</mi> <mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi> </msub> </math>. When each runner reaches position <math alttext="x equals x sub f" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>, the runners have the same speed.
content.question: Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="v sub P" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi> </msub> </math> and <math alttext="v sub Q" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub P is greater than v sub Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>Q</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="v sub P is less than v sub Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>Q</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, v sub P equals v sub Q, close parenthesis, is greater than 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>Q</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v sub P equals v sub Q, which equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>Q</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="v sub P is greater than v sub Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>P</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mtext>Q</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
